All The Codes!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Game Shark Codes & Dex Drive Saves: All The Codes!
By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, June 13, 2000 - 11:35 am:

MONSTER RANCHER 2

The Complete GameShark Cheater's Guide

by xiaNaix@mindless.com

MONSTER RANCHER 2 MACUMBA
(Site no longer online. We will post a link to any new sites xiaNaix establishes in the future.)
Updated 09/29/99


WARNING!!! The use of these codes may spoil the Monster Rancher 2 experience.
I hope you will instead use them sparingly to "enhance" your game.

The codes were created & tested using a "Caetla" Game Enhancer cart
and should work fine for GameShark version 2.42 & GameShark Pro.
Not all codes will work properly with older version carts,
nor the later Gameshark CD steup with the memory card accesory.
Whenever possible, I have tried to include alternate versions.

Feel free to post these wherever necessary, in whatever format, but be sure to include my author credit and a link to my website, Monster Rancher 2 Macumba. I spent many hours hacking and testing, and nobody likes a code thief.

Look for updates and DexDrive saves on my site. The URL is above.

GENERAL CODES
*****************************************************************************

Max Funds
80098FBC E0FF
80098FBE 05F5


Current Date
80099228 xxxx
xxxx=0000 (04/01/1000)
1 Week = +0001(h)


All Monster Cards
(Caetla/Game Enhancer) B00CC002 00000000
8009908C 0101

(GameShark 2.42+ and 5000CC02 0000
"Pro") 8009908C 0101


Full Zooming in View Mode
D001C3CC 2821
8001C3D0 0000
D001C3CC 2821
8001C3D2 0000

30099386 0001 find the proper memory locations to edit,
and there may very well be a few more.

50002601 0000 to breed, please email me with the details.

NOTES:

Items listed as "???" or "n/a" are still present in the game but are missing names and/or
descriptions, and my be unobtainable through regular play. It is unclear whether they are
simply untranslated by the U.S. programming team, or have been removed completely.

28 = Some type of genie lamp. No name or description listed.
3E = Cigarette. Present in the Japanese version, but unlisted in the U.S. release.
42 = Unknown.
6A = Match. No description given.
6B = Toothpick. No description given. May have been removed from U.S. release.
6D = Whetstone. No description given. May have been removed from U.S. release.
6E = Polish. No description given.
6F = Silk Cloth. No description given. May have been removed from U.S. release.
82 = No Desire. No description given. Used for Likes/Dislikes.
83 = Tourney/Battle. No description given. Used for Likes/Dislikes.
84 = Rest. No description given. Used for Likes/Dislikes.
85 = Play. No description given. Used for Likes/Dislikes.

***

Note from Lisa:
These codes often do not act as intended on the current gameshark, the one that uses a CD along with the device that plugs into a memory card slot. They were designed for the models that plugged into the serial post, in the back
of the PSX.
At any rate, use fo codes may affect far more attributes than you intended, and can result in your game freezing up, glitches and more.
Neither this site, nor xiaNaix warranty the codes in any way. Use them at your own risk.
